The required key features and functionality:

1. For Customers: 
The customer-facing side must prioritize ease of use, transparency, and product quality:
- User-friendly interface: An intuitive and mobile-responsive design for seamless browsing and ordering on any device.
- Detailed product showcase: High-quality images and comprehensive descriptions, build trust and aid decision-making.
- Customizable orders: Options to select specific cuts, weights, and packaging preferences to replicate the in-person butcher experience.
- Advanced search and filtering: The ability to easily find products by type, price, brand, or dietary preferences.
- Secure and multiple payment options: Integration with various secure payment gateways (credit cards, digital wallets, etc.) for a frictionless checkout process.
- Order tracking and status: Real updates on the order status from preparation to delivery, which manages expectations and builds trust.
- Flexible delivery scheduling: The ability to choose preferred delivery dates and time slots.
- Order history & re-ordering: Easy access to past orders for quick re-purchasing of favorite items.

2. For Business Owners (Admin/Management Panel)
The back-end system should focus on operational efficiency, inventory management, and data analysis:  
- Product and catalog management: Tools to easily add, edit, or remove products, update pricing, availability status, and manage different cuts and packaging options.
- Perishable inventory management: A specialized system to track stock levels in real-time, monitor expiration dates, and receive low-stock alerts to minimize waste.
- Order and fulfillment management: A centralized dashboard to efficiently process, manage, and assign orders to the packing and delivery teams.
- Integrated logistics and delivery management: Features for route optimization, order and driver tracking, and proof of delivery capture (signature/photo).
- Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Tools to manage customer databases, track preferences and purchase history, and handle customer complaints.
- Sales analytics and reporting: Detailed reports on sales performance, popular products, customer data, and growth trends to make data-driven decisions.
- Staff and store management: Features to manage staff roles and permissions, and oversee operations across multiple locations if applicable.
- Compliance and food safety tools: Built-in systems to ensure adherence to food safety regulations and provide product traceability.
- Secure payment processing & financial reporting: Management of all monetary transactions, including tax invoices and tracking earnings/payouts.
